page.title: 06Pope's Manor Binfield
page.content: Popes Manor was built around 1700 for the father of the poet Alexander Pope He wrote many of his poems in the garden.The original building was a small cottage.Over the years additions were made by different owners.In recent years it had become derelict, but in 1984 Bryants the builders bought it to use as head office.They have restored it to its Georgian glory. The company has given part of the ground to Bracknell District Council, who have opened it up as a park called Popes Meadow and as a playing field for St Marks school.In Popes Meadow there is a copse,a pond and a meadow. The copse is mainly holly,hawthorne, oak and hazel.In the unpolluted pond are found many tiny creatures such as freshwater shrimps,mayfly and caddis fly larvas.Foxes and rabbits live here
